title: 'Dada' to supporters, heir to Pawar politics: 5 turning points of 'workaholic' Ajit Pawar
content: Ajit Pawar, a formidable Maharashtra politician and six-time Deputy Chief Minister, tragically died in a plane crash. Known for his sharp instincts and administrative prowess, Pawar consistently pursued the top job but never attained it.

title: Before the first missiles fly: How India is preparing for invisible battlefields
content: India is strategically integrating AI, cyber, and electronic warfare into its military architecture, shifting from a platform-centric to a process-centric doctrine. This technological evolution, exemplified by Operation Sindoor, enhances intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance, aiming for strategic dominance and reduced reliance on foreign technology in future conflicts.

title: Ajit Pawar's sudden death leaves leadership vacuum - what is next for NCP
content: The sudden demise of NCP chief Ajit Pawar has cast a shadow over Maharashtra's political landscape, igniting questions about the future of his party. Analysts predict a leadership crisis and uncertainty regarding the potential merger of NCP factions and their future alliance with Sharad Pawar.

title: Ummah or moolah? Pakistan's high-stakes dilemma amid US-Iran conflict
content: Pakistan faces a perilous tightrope walk as US-Iran tensions escalate.  Caught between seeking vital US dollars for its economy and appeasing domestic Islamic sentiment, Islamabad is leveraging its unique diplomatic position.  The nation's history of strategic ambiguity and its proximity to Iran present both opportunities and immense risks, potentially drawing it into a dangerous regional conflict.

title: Governor of US state where Elon Musk wants all companies to move has ‘banned’ H1-B visas
content: Texas Governor Greg Abbott has halted new H-1B visa hiring across state agencies and public universities until May 2027, citing program abuse and prioritizing Texans for jobs. This directive contrasts with Elon Musk's push for professionals to relocate to Austin. The state, second only to California in H-1B holders, will also audit its foreign workforce.

title: Still no Gukesh! After Carlsen and Pragg, Norway Chess reveals new participant
content: Norway Chess has confirmed Germany’s top player Vincent Keymer as a participant for the 2026 event, alongside Magnus Carlsen and R Praggnanandhaa. Keymer will make his debut after a rapid rise to World No. 4. Praggnanandhaa returns for a third time, while fans still await confirmation of reigning world champion D Gukesh and Arjun Erigaisi.

title: Will Budget 2026 provide clarity on cryptocurrency taxation, simplify compliance?
content: India's booming crypto market, awaits clarity in Union Budget 2026. Following stringent measures in Budget 2025, including a 30% flat tax and 1% TDS, experts urge for nuanced rules on loss set-offs and asset classification. While some anticipate reforms, others foresee continued aggressive taxation, emphasizing compliance.

title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: What happened in 26 minutes and 5 unanswered questions
content: A Learjet 45 carrying Maharashtra's deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar crashed near Baramati runway after multiple landing attempts amid poor visibility. The aircraft burst into flames shortly after receiving landing clearance, raising questions about potential system failure, communication breakdown, or mechanical issues during the final approach.

title: Japan's second richest man 'drops' plan to spend $50 billion on buying American company
content: SoftBank's Masayoshi Son has reportedly halted talks to acquire US data center operator Switch Inc., a move that impacts his ambitious Stargate AI infrastructure plans. The $50 billion deal, crucial for generating computing power for OpenAI, faced internal concerns over its size and logistics. While a full acquisition is off, discussions for a partial investment or partnership continue.

title: Historic first: Cap Hansja Sharma becomes first woman pilot to fly Rudra armed helicopter
content: Captain Hansja Sharma has made history. She is the Indian Army's first woman pilot qualified to fly the Rudra Armed Helicopter. This marks a significant milestone for Army Aviation. Captain Sharma recently led the 251 Army Aviation Squadron during the Army Day Parade 2026. She hails from Jammu and topped her training course.

title: 'No security threat': Bangladesh questions India's move to recall diplomats' families
content: Bangladesh’s foreign affairs Adviser Md Touhid Hossain on Wednesday said that there was “no reason” for India to recall the family members of its diplomats from Dhaka. This comes after New Delhi cited precautionary safety concerns amid rising extremist activity ahead of the country’s general elections scheduled for February 2026.

title: How H-1B visa filing in 2026 are changing: Auditing job roles, offering salaries before registration and ...
content: US employers are adopting a more cautious H-1B visa strategy for the March 2026 lottery, driven by new fees and wage-weighted selection. Companies are auditing roles, increasing base salaries, and reducing speculative applications due to regulatory and cost pressures, expecting a significant drop in registrations.

title: 'Any day now': US, India trade talks in final stage
content: ​The India-US trade deal aims to more than double two way trade from the current level of $191 billion to $500 billion by 2030. Initial discussions on the agreement were announced during Prime Minister Modi’s visit to Washington in February 2025.

title: FIR filed against Ranveer Singh over Kantara Daiva mimicry remark
content: An FIR has been registered against Ranveer Singh at the High Grounds Police Station in Bengaluru for allegedly insulting Hindu religious sentiments and the Chavundi Daiva tradition of coastal Karnataka. The case was filed on Wednesday.

title: 'Purely an accident': Sharad Pawar rules out conspiracy in nephew Ajit's death; makes appeal
content: Veteran leader Sharad Pawar has dismissed conspiracy theories surrounding the tragic plane crash that claimed the life of his nephew, Ajit Pawar.  He emphasized that the incident was a pure accident, urging against any political exploitation of the tragedy. Ajit Pawar, a six-term Deputy Chief Minister, died en route to Baramati. Investigations are underway.

title: Travis Kelce supports Taylor Swift amid legal troubles as wedding plans pause
content: Travis Kelce has become a steady source of support for Taylor Swift as she navigates emotional strain linked to ongoing legal troubles around her inner circle. While staying publicly silent, Swift has leaned on Kelce’s guidance to protect her peace, set boundaries, and address personal tensions directly, even as wedding plans remain on pause.

title: 'No one’s more deserving': Tom Brady reacts to Bill Belichick HOF snub
content: Bill Belichick's exclusion from the Pro Football Hall of Fame in his first year of eligibility has sparked widespread debate. Tom Brady passionately defended his former coach, calling him the most deserving candidate ever. Despite Belichick's overwhelming career achievements, controversies may have influenced voters, raising questions about Hall of Fame standards.

title: David Robinson’s current net worth and career earnings explained
content: NBA legend David Robinson, nicknamed 'The Admiral,' has built a $200 million fortune beyond his Hall of Fame basketball career.  His success comes from smart financial planning, including founding private equity funds that invested heavily in real estate.  Robinson also dedicates significant efforts to philanthropy, notably establishing the Carver Academy to support underprivileged children.

title: Hardik steals the show with a bullseye during 4th T20I - Watch
content: Hardik Pandya stole the spotlight in the fourth T20I against New Zealand with a brilliant direct-hit run-out of captain Mitchell Santner in Visakhapatnam. The moment came in the 18th over and halted New Zealand’s late momentum. Despite strong knocks from Tim Seifert and Devon Conway, India stayed competitive through sharp bowling and energetic fielding, with Pandya’s effort proving a key turning point.

title: From Kobe to entire team: Remembering air tragedies in sports history
content: The death of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar in a plane crash deeply shocked India, drawing tributes from leading athletes and administrators. His passing revived memories of devastating air disasters that have scarred the sporting world, including the Munich Air Tragedy, Kobe Bryant’s crash, Chapecoense’s fatal flight, the Andes disaster, Emiliano Sala’s death, the Leicester City helicopter crash, and the 1993 Zambian team tragedy.

title: 'My stomach sank': Ajit Pawar's account of 2024 chopper trip goes viral - watch
content: A 2024 video has resurfaced in which Ajit Pawar shared his mid-air scare experience with Devendra Fadnavis and Uday Samant. In the resurfaced video, the three ministers were flying form Nagpur to Gadchiroli to attend the foundation stone-laying ceremony of a steel plant. Addressing the gathering after their arrival, Pawar narrated how the helicopter entered thick cloud cover, leaving no visibility outside.

title: No glasses, no blur? You could still have glaucoma, experts reveal the symptoms and debunk myths
content: Glaucoma poses a silent threat to vision, particularly for adults over 40. This condition damages the optic nerve, often without early symptoms. Regular eye exams are crucial for early detection and treatment. Experts emphasize that timely intervention can prevent vision loss. Awareness of subtle signs like blurred vision or reduced side vision is key to protecting eyesight.

title: Inspired by Kapil Dev, how a Chandigarh coach produced two world-class all-rounders
content: From Kapil Dev to Yuvraj Singh and now Amanjot Kaur, Chandigarh has produced three World Cup-winning all-rounders. At the heart of the city’s latest success story is coach Nagesh Gupta, who nurtured Amanjot and Kashvee Gautam from raw bowlers into elite seam-bowling all-rounders, blending skill, resilience and a long-term vision.

title: Why Trump supporters are gunning for Kash Patel and Kristi Noem
content: For decades, the conservative movement had argued the opposite: that the right to bear arms did not dissolve in public spaces, that lawful carry was not conditional on political context, and that armed presence alone was not provocation. Noem, a longtime MAGA figure who once filmed campaign ads firing rifles, appeared to be saying out loud what gun-control advocates had argued for years.

title: 'I know hunger...': How a Mumbai man turned his struggles into a lifetime of giving
content: Mumbai's Hussain Mansuri, a social media sensation with 17 million followers, quietly transforms lives through consistent acts of kindness. From providing freezers for vendors to offering substantial financial aid for medical emergencies, his generosity, rooted in his own past struggles, restores dignity and hope.

title: 'Next attack will be far worse': Trump's stern warning to Iran; Tehran rejects talks
content: US President Trump issued a stark warning to Iran, urging them to negotiate an "equitable" deal without nuclear weapons or face an attack far worse than "Operation Midnight Hammer." He reiterated claims of a massive "Armada" fleet heading towards Iran. Tehran rejected talks, deeming them impossible in an "atmosphere of threats," and stated that diplomacy cannot be effective under military pressure.

title: Carlos Alcaraz’s player box moment with DJ Peggy Gou turns heads
content: Carlos Alcaraz beat Alex de Minaur in straight sets at the 2026 Australian Open as DJ Peggy Gou watched from his player box. Days after their Seoul dinner, her presence caught attention in Melbourne. Alcaraz confirmed their friendship and said he hopes to reach the final to watch her perform at AO Live.

title: Baramati's bitter irony: The town that made 'dada' Ajit Pawar, then claimed him
content: Baramati, the Pawar family's political stronghold, witnessed the end of Ajit Pawar's political journey. The constituency that propelled his rise also became the site of his final chapter, where he decisively reaffirmed his dominance by defeating his grandnephew in a deeply personal electoral battle.

title: Why Ishan Kishan is not playing 4th T20I: Suryakumar Yadav drops bombshell at toss
content: India's captain Suryakumar Yadav won the toss and chose to bowl first against New Zealand in the fourth T20I. Having already secured the series 3-0, India aims to maintain momentum and refine their winning habits. Arshdeep Singh replaces the injured Ishan Kishan, who had a stellar series with the bat.

title: Sunny Deol’s second rising: How a 68 year old action icon is a sensation again
content: At 68, Sunny Deol's unexpected revival is turning the tide in Bollywood. With the spectacular achievements of Gadar 2 and Jaat, he's establishing himself as a powerhouse, anchoring significant films such as Border 2. This remarkable comeback not only challenges industry trends but also showcases his lasting charisma, paving the way for exciting ventures like Ramayan and Lahore 1947.

title: 'Runway in sight' ... then flames: How Ajit Pawar's jet went down - sequence of events
content: Maharashtra deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar's aircraft crashed near Baramati airport shortly after being cleared to land, killing all five on board. The aircraft, registered VI-SSK, had initiated a go-around earlier due to the runway not being in sight. Flames were observed near the runway threshold moments after the landing clearance.

title: Australia in Lahore for T20I series even as Pak await government nod for T20 WC
content: Australia's T20I squad has arrived in Lahore for a series against Pakistan, which serves as final preparation for the upcoming T20 World Cup. However, Pakistan's participation in the tournament remains uncertain pending government approval, with a decision expected soon.  Several senior Australian players are resting for this series.

title: Emraan Hashmi says life changed overnight after son’s cancer diagnosis
content: Emraan Hashmi revealed that his life changed in 2014 when his son Ayaan was diagnosed with cancer. The painful five-year journey taught him patience, gratitude, and strength as a father. Now with his son healthy, Emraan focuses on gratitude and work, earning praise for his performance in the series 'Taskaree'.

title: Exclusive: Washington starts batting at BCCI CoE; India likely to play waiting game
content: India all-rounder Washington Sundar has resumed batting during his rehabilitation at the BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru but remains doubtful for the start of the T20 World Cup due to a rib injury. With tenderness persisting and limited off-spin options available, the team management is adopting a cautious approach before taking a final call.

title: Jake Browning’s fiancée teases Super Bowl LX fit: ‘We’re going to the Bow’
content: Jake Browning’s fiancée Stephanie Niles teased a Super Bowl LX outfit on TikTok, saying she took inspiration from Kendall Jenner and planned to customize a silver, backless jumpsuit with team-name stickers. She did not reveal the team, but she celebrated the Seattle Seahawks’ NFC title win and wrote, “WE’RE GOING TO THE BOWL BABY!!!!!!”

title: Ajit Pawar death: Sule breaks down for her 'dada'; a bond beyond the NCP split
content: Supriya Sule broke down in tears upon learning of her cousin Ajit Pawar's death in a plane crash near Baramati. The tragedy occurred as Pawar was traveling to address rallies, casting a shadow over the recent political rift within the Pawar family and raising questions about the future of his NCP faction.

title: 'Hey Pak, don't come, you'll be thrashed': India World Cup-winner warns Mohsin Naqvi
content: Former India opener Krishnamachari Srikkanth has urged Pakistan to skip the T20 World Cup after PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi hinted at a potential withdrawal. Naqvi's remarks, made in solidarity with Bangladesh, drew a sharp response from Srikkanth, who warned Pakistan they would be comprehensively thrashed if they toured India.

title: Kerala HC closes petitions that questioned confidentiality of State government’s agreement with Sprinklr
content: The U.S.-based data analytics firm and the Kerala govt. had entered a tie-up for managing COVID-related data

title: Government demands apology from Opposition for protesting during President’s address to Parliament
content: Members of Congress and its allies raised slogans against the VB-G RAM G Act, demanding its rollback as soon as President Murmu began her address to a joint sitting of Parliament

title: Are States building castles in the air about facilities to sterilise stray dogs, Supreme Court asks
content: States fail to comply with SC directions on fencing institutional areas, removing strays from roads and highways; no specific data on number of bites, sterilisation capacity in States’ “vague” affidavits, says SC

title: Wings India 2026: Focus on enhancing safety, passenger experience and resilience, says Civil Aviation Secretary
content: Hyderabad has emerged as a major aviation aerospace and MRO hub, supported by progressive policies, and strong industry participation, the official told Wings India 2026

title: Parents, students stage protest to save govt. school in Ballari district
content: The Hosa Yaragudi government school is the only public school available for children from poor families in the village, says AIDSO

title: 76% safai karmacharis in central government from SC, ST, OBC groups: DoPT data
content: SC, ST, OBC employees account for 39.88% of all Group A posts in 80 Central Ministries and Departments as on January 1, 2024; no data on representation of EWS employees

title: India’s civil aviation sector offers vast growth opportunities: PM
content: Only a few countries have such large-scale development plans, offer policy stability and pursue technological ambition as India, Narendra Modi tells Wings India 2026 conference being held in Hyderabad

title: SHRC orders probe into alleged drug trafficking around Kaloor stadium
content: The investigating officers have been asked to submit separate reports to the State Human Rights Commission within a month

title: 25 out of 110 micro breweries’ licences given to ministers’ coteries: Harish Rao
content: The BRS leader accuses the ruling party of allotting 25 out 110 licenses to those recommended by bigwigs

title: Cabinet nod for 583-km RRTS for high-speed rail travel in Kerala
content: A formal letter will be sent to the Centre expressing the State’s interest in the project. The Cabinet has also tasked the Transport department with initiating the necessary consultations.

title: Case filed against woman for ‘blackmailing’ Kodur MLA
content: MLA’s mother files an extortion case against the woman who earlier levied sexual exploitation allegations on the JSP leader

title: ED attaches ₹1,885 crore in assets linked to Reliance Anil Ambani Group to recover ‘bank dues’
content: The ED has alleged fraudulent diversion of public money by various Reliance Anil Ambani group companies including RCom, RHFL, RCFL, Reliance Infrastructure, and Reliance Power Limited

title: Cash-for-jobs complaint in K.N. Nehru’s Municipal Administration department was sent to DVAC on November 1, Tamil Nadu government tells Madras High Court
content: Advocate General P.S. Raman says, the DVAC will summon for inquiry whomever its finds answerable to the allegations

title: ICAR-CTCRI commercialises purple taro variety
content: Noted for its purple-streaked flesh, this taro is agronomically valued for its yield potential of 1.5 to 2.0 kg per plant

title: Maiden session of new Kozhikode Corporation  Council sees long debates on key issues
content: Opposition councillors allege large-scale irregularities in the maintenance contract of the sewage treatment plant at Government Medical College Hospital; VACB probe sought

title: Probe ordered into livestreaming of tiff between doctors and BJP MLA in Udhampur
content: Several doctors object to theProbe ordered into livestreaming of tiff between doctors and BJP MLA in Udhampur, which evoked sharp reactions from netizens online; Deputy CM Surinder Choudhary warns of action against employees ‘ignoring elected representatives’

title: G-Spider, AI-equipped canal cleaning system, launched in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The robotic system was first deployed near the spot where sanitation worker N. Joy ventured into the canal for cleaning in 2024 and lost his life

title: HYDRAA to crack down on establishments violating fire-safety norms
content: Establishments which are found violating fire safety norms will be sealed immediately and their power supply disconnected

title: Concern over change in PIN codes following closure of post offices in north Kerala
content: ​In north Kerala, which covers six districts from Kasaragod to Palakkad, a total of 13 sub-post offices have been closed or merged, according to official data

title: International Theatre Festival of Kerala: When a play could not travel, its absence took the stage
content: Denied travel clearance, The Last Play in Gaza was replaced by voices, music and testimony as ITFoK turned solidarity into a powerful act of remembrance

title: Watch | Ground Report: How did Ajit Pawar’s tragic plane crash at Baramati unfold?
content: In this ground report, we trace how the incident unfolded, what eyewitnesses reported, the emergency response on the ground, and the latest official updates.

title: Chamundi Betta walk on Feb. 1 to protest development works on hills
content: Activists have specifically raised concerns over development works under the PRASHAD scheme and have demanded their immediate halt

title: Kerala’s ruling front and the opposition offer starkly different views of the government in the House
content: Mr. Satheesan sought to paint the picture of a Kerala in decline under ten years of LDF rule, and the government was anti-minority and pro-BJP. Mr. Vijayan said Congress’s lies would not pass muster with voters, and the party’s elected representatives were vulnerable to poaching by the BJP, since it had no clear line against Hindutva and minority communalism

title: Rules amended to allow single application for green consent
content: Integrated consents will reduce multiple applications, shorten timelines for approvals while retaining strong provisions for monitoring, compliance and cancellation, says Environment Ministry

title: Nine injured, four seriously, in dog attack in Dharwad; canine stoned to death
content: The injured, including a five-year-old boy, were attacked at Shiradi Layout near University of Agricultural Sciences

title: E-Swathu 2.0 hit by technical glitches: Priyank Kharge
content: He said it would take about a month to rectify the problems and ensure smooth service delivery to rural property owners

title: Psychiatry student found dead at DIMHANS hostel
content: According to sources, she was upset for the last few days and expressed her unwillingness to stay in Dharwad to pursue her studies

title: Nam Saali, a film on rural education crisis, selected for BIFFES
content: The film highlights the pivotal role of government schools in sustaining rural society and preserving its social and cultural fabric

title: Woman’s death in Kozhikode: police to move custody application for accused
content: It was on January 24 that the 26-year-old woman was found dead inside Vaisakhan’s workshop at Malikkadavu

title: State taking all steps to prevent human deaths from elephant attacks: Forest Minister
content: Eshwar Khandre inspects the Shettihalli Wildlife Sanctuary as part of efforts to redraw its boundaries

title: Sources: Browns hiring Monken as new coach
content: The Browns are hiring former Ravens offensive coordinator Todd Monken as their next head coach, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Giannis preps for Bucks exit amid offers
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo is ready for a new home ahead of the trade deadline as several teams have made aggressive offers to the Bucks, league sources told ESPN.

title: Mensah commits to Miami after Duke settlement
content: Darian Mensah and Duke have agreed to a settlement of their dispute that cleared the way for the quarterback's transfer to Miami.

title: Rodman coaxes dance from Hayes in USWNT rout
content: Trinity Rodman capped off the USWNT's 5-0 rout of Chile by coaxing coach Emma Hayes into a sideline dance, as a young American squad secured its fifth consecutive shutout Tuesday night.

title: Sources: Belichick not a 1st-ballot Hall of Famer
content: Bill Belichick, the eight-time Super Bowl-winning coach, will not be a first-ballot Hall of Famer, sources told ESPN.

title: Fury to face Makhmudov in comeback fight
content: Tyson Fury's return to the ring has been confirmed with the former heavyweight world champion set to fight Arslanbek Makhmudov on April 11.

title: Sources: Broncos fire OC after falling short of SB...
content: Broncos offensive coordinator Joe Lombardi was fired Tuesday along with wide receivers coach Keary Colbert and cornerbacks coach Addison Lynch.

title: Djokovic, down 2 sets, advances when Musetti hurt
content: Novak Djokovic will play in his 13th Australian Open semifinal after his opponent, Lorenzo Musetti, retired from their match while leading the 24-time major champion 6-4, 6-3, 1-3.

title: Nebraska's 24-game win streak ends vs. Michigan
content: Nebraska's improbable run, the longest in Division I since since Gonzaga reeled off 35 in a row between 2019 and 2021, came to a halt against the No. 3 Wolverines.

title: Wetzel: Belichick's first-ballot bid was a no-brainer
content: The humiliation of snubbing Bill Belichick is on the committee and, in turn, on the Hall of Fame itself.

content: Could George Pickens, Breece Hall and Malik Willis land big contracts? Here are the top 50 free agents heading into the offseason.

content: NFL free agency starts on March 11. What does the future look like for these 32 soon-to-be free agents?

title: Ranking the top 50 men's college basketball players: Cameron Boozer, then who?
content: No. 1 and 2 were not up for debate. The rest? Fair game. See who made the cut based on performances so far.

title: When football meets third grade curriculum: The rise of NFeLementary
content: Mary Crippen, a third grade educator based in Florida, built NFeLementary by expanding on a football-based curriculum her mother created decades earlier.

title: Bobby Marks' NBA trade deadline guide: What to kno...
content: What deals could kick-start the NBA trade deadline? Bobby Marks examines the players, picks and priorities you need to know for all 30 teams.

title: Best of Day 1 at the Senior Bowl: Which draft pros...
content: Here are the top NFL draft risers from the first day of Senior Bowl practices, where the defensive line class stood out.

title: The Lakers, the Cavaliers and LeBron's most dominant season ever
content: There are many similarities between this Lakers team and its season and the Cavaliers in 2017-18, which James says remains the best campaign of his illustrious career. He returns to Cleveland on Wednesday night.

content: Andreas Hale breaks down all the action from the last episode of "Raw" before Saturday's Royal Rumble.

title: Four ways a new CBA can get done
content: The 2026 season is just over 100 days away, but negotiations between the WNBA and players' union are at a stalemate.

title: How to reach the Champions League knockouts: Can Man City, Chelsea avoid the playoff round?
content: We're less than a week away from knowing which 24 teams advance from the league phase. Here's what's at stake with only one matchweek to go.

content: At every set piece, you can find numerous players grabbing, holding and wrestling with their opponents.

title: Power Rankings: Can Tennessee test UConn?
content: The Lady Vols return to the rankings ahead of their date with the No. 1 Huskies, the nation's last unbeaten team.

title: Bills stay in-house with Joe Brady hire for head coach. Why, and what's next?
content: If change was needed to get the Bills over the Super Bowl hump, how does bringing in someone tied to past failures accomplish that?

content: From CFP (and FCS playoff) classics to OT thrillers and what-the-heck moments, this season had it all.

title: Four offseason lessons from two unlikely Super Bowl teams: Savvy moves for the Seahawks, Patriots
content: It's easy to be skeptical about big free agency spending, midtier QB contracts and defensive-minded coaches. But the Seahawks and Patriots proved everyone wrong.

content: Colorado is flirting with NHL records for team performance. We dive deep on the NHL's most dominant team.

title: How to bet the Farmers Insurance Open: English, Matsuyama set up for success
content: The third stop of the PGA Tour brings us to San Diego, where scoring could be hard to come by at Torrey Pines.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi clubs eye PSG's Dembele amid contract issues
content: The Saudi Pro League is "laying the groundwork" for a move for PSG star Ousmane Dembele.Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: What to expect from Murakami, Okamoto, Imai and more
content: Todd Zola dives into the statistics to tell us what exactly we should expect from some of the players coming to MLB in 2026 from overseas.

title: Shakur Stevenson is not asking for respect -- he is demanding it
content: Shakur Stevenson has called out boxing's biggest names. Now, he's ready to prove he's better than all of them.

title: Ranking this weekend's fights: From Lopez-Shakur to Zayas-Baraou
content: Nick Parkinson ranks the weekend's fights from best to worst and breaks down what's at stake in each matchup.

title: 'Bulldoze these guys': Alexander Volkanovski's vow after 2,996 days of waiting
content: By the time Alexander Volkanovski makes his Octagon walk on Sunday, it will be 2,996 days since he last fought in Sydney. A lot has changed since then, but a late-career lingering UFC narrative remains a constant.

title: Seven bets to make on Drake Maye and Sam Darnold in the Super Bowl
content: Matt Bowen breaks down the QBs and offers his best bets on Drake Maye and Sam Darnold in the Super Bowl.

title: Benny the Bull picks new number after Derrick Rose's No. 1 jersey retirement
content: Benny had worn No. 1 since 1969. In honor of Rose's jersey retirement, the beloved mascot enters a new era.

title: New Video Shows Ajit Pawar's Plane Tilting To The Left Before Crash
content: New CCTV footage has emerged showing the Learjet 45 carrying Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and four others tilting to its left moments before crashing near the Baramati airport on Wednesday morning.

title: "Very Significant Progress": India Says US Trade Pact Nearing Closure
content: India and the United States have made "very significant progress" on their ongoing trade deal talks and are "very close" to a positive outcome, government sources have told NDTV.

title: Poll Body vs Trinamool To Escalate? 25 Bengal Officers Made Central Observers
content: In a move that is likely to escalate the face-off between the Election Commission and the West Bengal government, the poll panel has picked 15 IAS officers, including the Bengal Home secretary, and 10 IPS officers from the state as central observers.

title: Ajit Pawar Plane Crash Live Updates: Ajit Pawar Dies In Plane Crash, Aviation Minister Says Probe Will Be Conducted In "Transparent" Manner
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and four other persons were killed after an aircraft carrying them crashed in Pune district on Wednesday morning.

title: "Gone Full Retard": Musk Abuses Indian-Origin Billionaire Over Racism Claims
content: The exchange was triggered by a post from Elon Musk saying that “white people are a rapidly diminishing minority of the global population.”

title: 3-Year-Old Mumbai Girl Killed As Speaker Boxes Fall On Her, 2 Charged
content: A three-year-old girl was killed after two loudspeakers, installed as part of Republic Day celebrations, fell on her in Mumbai's Vikhroli area, police said on Wednesday.

title: 'Don't Dance To Trinamool Leaders' Tune': BJP Chief To Bengal Bureaucrats
content: The BJP's newly-elected National President, Nitin Nabin, on Wednesday, asked the bureaucrats in West Bengal, especially the District Magistrates and the Sub-Divisional officers, not to blindly follow orders of the ruling Trinamool Congress leaders.

title: Mamata Banerjee Says Will Move Court "As Common Citizen" Against Bengal SIR
content: Demanding accountability from the Centre on this matter, Chief Minister Banerjee warned that she would move court as an individual if necessary.

title: As Adani Group, Embraer Announce Deal, Boeing Says Its Focus Is "Long Term"
content: India's ambitions to become a global hub for aircraft manufacturing received fresh momentum this week with the announcement of a collaboration between the Adani Group and Brazil's Embraer.

title: Marco Rubio Warns Venezuela Of New Military Action If Expectations Not Met
content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio plans on Wednesday to warn that the Trump administration is ready to take new military action against Venezuela if the country's interim leadership strays from US expectations.

title: PM Modi Likely To Visit Israel In February To Deepen Strategic Ties
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to visit Israel in February, giving a fresh push to the rapidly expanding strategic partnership between the two countries, Israel's Ambassador to India Reuven Azar has hinted to NDTV.

title: How Ajit Pawar Plane Crash Sends Tremors Through Maharashtra Politics
content: The ruling Mahayuti in Maharashtra, battling disagreements and recovering from an acrimonious campaign for the local body polls, has been dealt its most devastating blow yet.

title: Bhopal Slaughterhouse Trail: Power, Protection And Beef That Shook The System
content: The sealed slaughterhouse in Bhopal's Jinsi area has prompted many more unsettling questions than alleged cow slaughter alone.

title: "Next Attack Will Be Far Worse": Trump's Latest Threat To Iran
content: US President Donald Trump appeared on Wednesday to threaten another attack on Iran if it does not "make a deal" on nuclear weapons, after Tehran rejected talks.

title: Pilot Shambhavi Pathak Among 5 Dead In Plane Crash That Killed Ajit Pawar
content: Shambhavi Pathak was operating the VSR Ventures Learjet 45, registered as VT-SSK, along with Pilot Captain Sumit Kapur.

title: Ten Minutes From Kanpur, The Plane Crash That Killed Madhavrao Scindia
content: On September 30, 2001, the Congress lost one of its brightest leaders, Madhavrao Scindia, in a plane crash 10 minutes from Kanpur

title: Ajit Pawar's Last Rites To Be Performed At 11 Am In Baramati Tomorrow
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar's last rites will be performed with full state honours, Maharashtra General Administration Department (Protocol) informed on Wednesday.

title: PM Modi Speaks To Sharad Pawar, Condoles Ajit Pawar's Death
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to NCP-SP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday and expressed condolences at the death of his nephew, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar.

title: "Papa, I'm Flying With Ajit Pawar To Baramati": Crew Member's Last Call To Father
content: Ajit Pawar Death: The final phone conversation between flight attendant Pinky Mali and her father, Shivkumar Mali, has emerged following the Baramati plane crash that claimed the lives of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and four others.

title: Amazon To Fire 16,000 People Globally, Replace Them With AI
content: Amazon is slashing about 16,000 corporate jobs in the second round of mass layoffs for the ecommerce company in three months.

title: Veteran trade union leader Anantha Subba Rao passes away
content: Associated with the All India Trade Union Congress his entire life, he was in the forefront of particularly the transport workers union in Karnataka

title: NIA raids nine locations in Kerala as part of probe against PFI
content: Case registered by National Investigation Agency in September 2022 accusing PFI of criminal conspiracy and acts to spread the idea of violent jihad in India with the aim of dismembering and taking over the country

title: Ed Lab formally inaugurated in Chitradurga
content: It has been set up with an objective of bringing meaningful and lasting change to the education ecosystem

title: DRDA commences work to lay forest road connecting hillock temple on Vellore-Tirupattur border
content: DRDA officials say the stretch would be laid between Poolankakuttai Road and Dharmakondaraja Koil Road, covering a distance of 2.6 km

title: A.P. Minister to visit UK, Qatar to study best practices for Amaravati Sports City project
content: The visit is intended to gain exposure to advanced urban planning models, sports infrastructure development, and global standards that can be adapted in Andhra Pradesh

title: International Theatre Festival of Kerala: Romeo and Juliet, reimagined in sweat, soil and laughter
content: Asterions Hus Theatre’s high-octane, physical comedy turns Shakespeare’s tragedy into a riotous celebration of love at ITFoK

title: Kudumbashree joins hands with distributors’ forum to market products
content: Kudumbashree existing products and those under K-INAM products will be sold through retail shops and supermarkets with supporters of All Kerala Distributors’ Association

title: Wings India 2026 day one: sky show steals the spotlight
content: An aerobatic display by UK pilots and a meticulously choreographed drone show turned the opening day of Wings India 2026 into a spectacle; from high-speed aerial manoeuvres to illuminated formations tracing India’s aviation story, the sky above Begumpet became a living canvas, blending technology, precision and narrative to close day one on a dramatic note

title: ‘Satyagraha’ at Kennedy Center: Philip Glass leads boycott against Trump takeover
content: Philip Glass has withdrawn the world premiere of his Symphony no 15 from the MAGA-infused Kennedy Center in washington DC . the decision is redolent of nonviolent Gandhian protest embodied in his landmark opera Satyagraha . glass announced this week that the Kennedy Center’s current direction under president Trump conflicts fundamentally with the values his symphony seeks to uphold .
